Variable Documentation

int iVSLCLStatus = VSLCL_STATUS_OFF [static]

The library status.

iVSLCLStatus will hold information on the library's operating status. Any function that requires proper initialization of the library will first check this variable and return with an error code if accessing the library would create an error.

Definition at line 54 of file vslabclib.c.

int iVSLSocket = 0 [static]

The socket descriptor for remote vslab server access.

Declaration of static variables that work across library functions - don't attempt to use them outside the library! iVSLSocket will hold the socket descriptor returned by socket() to easily access the remote device once it is opened. Remember that the socket descriptor is not the only way to identify a remote system - here the socket descriptor is used only as a descriptor refering to ONE socket that is used for any server the library communicates with.

Definition at line 44 of file vslabclib.c.

char unicast_addr[IP_ADDR_LEN] = VSLS_UNICAST_ADDRESS [static]

Remote system IP address.

Unicast_addr holds the unicast address of the remote system being used by the library. As this library does not support multiple server nodes, a call to this function BEFORE vslcl_Open() gives us the ability to override the default setting of VSLS_UNICAST_ADDRESS.

Definition at line 89 of file vslabclib.c.

struct pl_data vsls_data [static]

Target node data structure.

vsls_data is an instance of struct pl_data (see packetlib.h) that is mainly used by vslcl_call_function() to communicate with the target node.

Definition at line 97 of file vslabclib.c.

struct sockaddr_in vsls_local [static]

Local socket information.

vsls_local holds information about the local system.

Definition at line 61 of file vslabclib.c.

struct sockaddr_in vsls_remote [static]

Remote socket information.

vsls_remote holds information about the remote system.
